body: Could you recheck this on the demo env?

> Could you recheck this on the demo env?

Such as?
It is on the website, https://skywalking.apache.org/#demo.

> It is on the website, https://skywalking.apache.org/#demo.

I'm not sure what I need to configure for this UI. Could you please make it clear? Thank you
What do you mean configure? I mean, if this is a code level issue, you should be able to see the error when you visit the demo SkyWalking, which is the same codes you are using.
I can't see what is error. How could I guess this?

Issue without description.

> Is there any plan to develop the WebSocket agent plugin?

What do you mean plan? The community counts on the contributors. We usually don't assign tasks. If you want to establish a new thing around SkyWalking, we are glad to help.
Is there a plugin for tracking websocket messages?
Take a look at the support list doc. I remember there was one there. But don't know whether you ask that.
Could you submit a pull request directly?

We have placed an ELB in front of OAP servers for load balancing, and our services and OAP servers reside in the same VPC on AWS, so the services send tracing logs to OAP internally, we think it's secure enough.
The main reason is that we don't like to maintain the CA files along with skywalking agents as the certificates should updated when they are expired.

Are you doing this in the product environment? Theoretical, this is not very secure. Because the server side is not being checked. But this is just my advice, not a block.

@arronbin Sorry, I did not reproduce this problem, Could you provide a demo app to reproduce the problem?

That is the problem of spring-boot-devtools. When using spring-boot-devtools, spring uses RestartClassLoader to load the org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping class.
But the class org.springframework.web.method.HandlerMethod was loaded by AppClassLoader, so the same plugin was loaded with different AgentClassLoader, which resulted in a conversion exception. The spring-boot-devtools package is to implement similar hot deployment functions. I have not yet figured out how to fix this problem. Here is an explanation of this problem. If someone encounters a similar problem, please remove the dependency of spring-boot-devtools.

版本：8.3.0
环境：Windows10
